episode: I went into labor 8 weeks early. I had to spend 3 weeks in the hospital.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: I went into labor 8 weeks early. I had to spend 3 weeks in the hospital.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: That must have been incredibly stressful and scary for you.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Yes, I was terrified for my baby.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: I can imagine. Premature birth can be so worrying. How's the baby now?

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: He was born completely healthy and years later is doing great. Thank you for asking.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: What a wonderful relief and blessing!

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: It sure is! I wish I had known at the time that everything would have been fine.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Hindsight is always easier, isn't it?

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Absolutely

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: It's great that you can look back on it with peace now.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Yes, it seems like almost yesterday and also so long ago. The nice part of being in the hospital was having another set of eyes on my baby, so it was not all bad.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: The extra care and attention must've been reassuring.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: For the most part. I do remember shortly after having him, not being able to hold him as a nurse was inserting a feeding tube and she was struggling and that, too, was scary. I worried it was causing damage. But he seemed fine. It was a very stressful and scary time.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Those moments can be really traumatic for a new mom.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Yes, for sure. I camped out in the NICU but it was hard to sleep hundreds of feet away in my hospital room away from my new baby.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: That must've been so hard, being separated from him like that.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: It was hard. It was confusing, because at home, I would be responsible for doing everything. But at the hospital a nurse told me to take off one feeding and get some sleep and she would handle it.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: It's tough to let go and trust others with your baby's care.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Oh for sure. We did not let anyone else hold our baby for months, except for grandparents, because we were so scared he would get sick. He had to have different formula for awhile that is safer.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: That's completely understandable, given his premature birth.
